docs.title: Uco Tool
docs.text:
This ontology defines classes and properties for characterizing tools.

URI: https://w3id.org/linkmodel/uco-tool Name: uco-tool

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description AnalyticTool "An analytic tool is an artifact of hardware and/or software utilized to acco... BuildFacet "A build facet is a grouping of characteristics unique to a particular versio... BuildInformationType "A build information type is a grouping of characteristics that describe how ... BuildUtilityType "A build utility type characterizes the tool used to convert from source code... CompilerType "A compiler type is a grouping of characteristics unique to a specific progra... ConfiguredTool "A ConfiguredTool is a Tool that is known to be configured to run in a more s... DefensiveTool "A defensive tool is an artifact of hardware and/or software utilized to acco... LibraryType "A library type is a grouping of characteristics unique to a collection of re... MaliciousTool "A malicious tool is an artifact of hardware and/or software utilized to acco... Tool "A tool is an element of hardware and/or software utilized to carry out a par...

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Slot Description _cpeid "Specifies the Common Platform Enumeration identifier for the software _creator "The creator organization for a particular tool _references "References to information describing a particular tool _swid "Specifies the SWID tag for the software _version "An appropriate version descriptor of a particular tool buildConfiguration "How the build utility was configured for a particular build of a particular ... buildID "An externally defined unique identifier for a particular build of a software buildInformation "Describes how a particular tool was built buildLabel "Relevant label for a particular build of a particular software buildOutputLog "The output log of the build process for a software buildProject "The project name of a build of a software buildScript "The actual build script for a particular build of a particular software buildUtility "Identifies the utility used to build a software buildUtilityName "The informally defined name of the utility used to build a particular softwa... buildVersion "The appropriate version descriptor of a particular build of a particular sof... compilationDate "The compilation date for the build of a software compilerInformalDescription "An informal description of a compiler compilers "The compilers utilized during a particular build of a particular software libraries "The libraries incorporated into a particular build of a software libraryName "The name of the library libraryVersion "The version of the library servicePack "An appropriate service pack descriptor for a particular tool toolType "The type of tool

docs.title: Class: AddressFacet
docs.text:
An Address Facet is a grouping of characteristics unique to an administrative identifier for a geolocation associated with a specific identity.

URI: identity:AddressFacet

 classDiagram

      IdentityFacet <|-- AddressFacet

      AddressFacet : address

          AddressFacet ..> Location : address

docs.title: Class: AnalyticTool
docs.text:
"An analytic tool is an artifact of hardware and/or software utilized to accomplish a task or purpose of explanation, interpretation or logical reasoning."

URI: tool:AnalyticTool

 classDiagram
    class AnalyticTool
      Tool <|-- AnalyticTool

      AnalyticTool : _creator

          AnalyticTool ..> Identity : _creator

      AnalyticTool : _references

          AnalyticTool ..> iri type : _references

      AnalyticTool : _version

          AnalyticTool ..> string : _version

      AnalyticTool : createdBy

          AnalyticTool ..> string : createdBy

      AnalyticTool : description

          AnalyticTool ..> string : description

      AnalyticTool : externalReference

          AnalyticTool ..> string : externalReference

      AnalyticTool : hasFacet

          AnalyticTool ..> string : hasFacet

      AnalyticTool : modifiedTime

          AnalyticTool ..> datetime : modifiedTime

      AnalyticTool : name

          AnalyticTool ..> string : name

      AnalyticTool : objectCreatedTime

          AnalyticTool ..> datetime : objectCreatedTime

      AnalyticTool : objectMarking

          AnalyticTool ..> MarkingDefinitionAbstraction : objectMarking

      AnalyticTool : servicePack

          AnalyticTool ..> string : servicePack

      AnalyticTool : specVersion

          AnalyticTool ..> string : specVersion

      AnalyticTool : tag

          AnalyticTool ..> string : tag

      AnalyticTool : toolType

          AnalyticTool ..> string : toolType

docs.title: Class: CompilerType
docs.text:
"A compiler type is a grouping of characteristics unique to a specific program that translates computer code written in one programming language (the source language) into another language (the target language). Typically a program that translates source code from a high-level programming language to a lower-level language (e.g., assembly language, object code, or machine code) to create an executable program. [based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compiler]"

URI: tool:CompilerType

 classDiagram
    class CompilerType
      UcoInherentCharacterizationThing <|-- CompilerType

      CompilerType : _cpeid

          CompilerType ..> string : _cpeid

      CompilerType : _swid

          CompilerType ..> string : _swid

      CompilerType : compilerInformalDescription

          CompilerType ..> string : compilerInformalDescription

docs.title: Class: IdentityAbstraction
docs.text:
An identity abstraction is a grouping of identifying characteristics unique to an individual or organization. This class is an ontological structural abstraction for this concept. Implementations of this concept should utilize the identity:Identity class.

URI: core:IdentityAbstraction

 classDiagram
    class IdentityAbstraction
      UcoObject <|-- IdentityAbstraction


      IdentityAbstraction <|-- Identity


      IdentityAbstraction : createdBy

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : createdBy

      IdentityAbstraction : description

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : description

      IdentityAbstraction : externalReference

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : externalReference

      IdentityAbstraction : hasFacet

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : hasFacet

      IdentityAbstraction : modifiedTime

          IdentityAbstraction ..> datetime : modifiedTime

      IdentityAbstraction : name

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : name

      IdentityAbstraction : objectCreatedTime

          IdentityAbstraction ..> datetime : objectCreatedTime

      IdentityAbstraction : objectMarking

          IdentityAbstraction ..> MarkingDefinitionAbstraction : objectMarking

      IdentityAbstraction : specVersion

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : specVersion

      IdentityAbstraction : tag

          IdentityAbstraction ..> string : tag

docs.title: Class: LanguagesFacet

docs.title: Class: MarkingDefinitionAbstraction
docs.text:
A marking definition abstraction is a grouping of characteristics unique to the expression of a specific data marking conveying restrictions, permissions, and other guidance for how marked data can be used and shared. This class is an ontological structural abstraction for this concept. Implementations of this concept should utilize the marking MarkingDefinition class.

docs.title: Class: UcoObject
docs.text:
A UCO object is a representation of a fundamental concept either directly inherent to the cyber domain or indirectly related to the cyber domain and necessary for contextually characterizing cyber domain concepts and relationships. Within the Unified Cyber Ontology (UCO) structure this is the base class acting as a consistent, unifying and interoperable foundation for all explicit and inter-relatable content objects.

URI: core:UcoObject

docs.title: Slot: modifiedTime
docs.text:
Specifies the time that this particular version of the object was modified. The object creator can use the time it deems most appropriate as the time this version of the object was modified. The value of the modified property for a given object version MUST be later than or equal to the value of the created property. Object creators MUST update the modified property when creating a new version of an object. The modified timestamp MUST be precise to the nearest millisecond (exactly three digits after the decimal place in seconds).

URI: core:modifiedTime
